title: Stop Babying Your EV: Hard Acceleration Actually Extends Battery Life by 195K Miles
description: New peer-reviewed research led by Stanford and published in Nature Energy found that EV battery life improves when cells experience the power “pulses” you get in real traffic. Compared with the old lab routine of perfectly steady charge/discharge cycles, dynamic driving extended usable life by up ...
titleSummary: "Taming Electric Fears: Aggressive Driving Surprisingly Boosts EV Battery Lifespan"
descriptionSummary: Researchers at Stanford have discovered that electric vehicle batteries benefit from the unpredictable power fluctuations encountered during real-world driving, increasing their lifespan beyond what's achieved through traditional lab testing methods.

title: Facelifted Nissan Z Already Underway – Here's What You Can Expect
description: It's been about three years since Nissan reintroduced the Z, and while that isn't exactly a long run, a few updates won't hurt. title: Hyundai's Most Affordable SUV Stays Cheap — and Feels It Too
description: The Hyundai Venue is the Korean marque's entry point into its rich SUV lineup. It's small, simple, and cheap to run, but it's not exactly a strong seller. title: When Surgeons Learned From Ferrari: How F1 Pit Crews Helped Save Newborn Lives
